title: Quantitative Autoradiographic Localization of Cholecystokinin Receptors in Rat and Guinea Pig Brain Using 125I-Bolton-Hunter-CCK8

key_findings.conclusion: Statistically significant differences in receptor binding between rat and guinea pig occurred in olfactory bulb, caudate-putamen, amygdala, several cortical areas, ventromedial hypothalamus, cerebellum, and a number of midbrain and brainstem nuclei.
key_findings.evidence: Results of the comparative quantitative autoradiographic analysis using 125I-Bolton-Hunter-CCK8.

applicable_situations.situation: Brain research comparing receptor distribution in different species
applicable_situations.advice: Consider using quantitative autoradiography to study receptor distribution in different brain regions of various mammalian species.
Use 125I-Bolton-Hunter-CCK8 for comparative analysis of CCK receptor binding in different brain regions.
